alert.note: Alert for Choctaw (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 5:31AM CDT until March 30 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN PUSHMATAHA AND EASTERN CHOCTAW COUNTIES... At 531 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles southeast of Oleta, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Hugo... Fort Towson... Sawyer... Rattan... Messer... Hugo Lake State Park... Raymond Gary State Park... Oleta... Cloudy... Corinne... Fallon... Sobol... Swink... Frogville... Apple... Dela... Huskey... TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for southeastern Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tulsa.
